intro: Minuartia tenuifolia f. laevipes, commonly known as the smoothleaf sandwort, is a low-growing, mat-forming plant belonging to the family Caryophyllaceae. It is characterized by its slender, often prostrate stems and small, lanceolate leaves that are smooth and slightly fleshy. The flowers are typically pink or white, with five petals and numerous stamens, blooming in early summer. This plant thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in alpine or arctic regions. It is a hardy species well adapted to harsh, cold environments.
